website_summaries.verdict: Kids learn about cause and effect when they interact with this sensory-rich water table.
pros: Kids use the bucket to create rainfall, which activates spinners and ramps
A rich tactile and visual experience
The table is large enough for multiple kids to play and develop social skills
cons: Some assembly is required, though it's not too difficult

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Wish the water lasted longer in the top
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Just wish the water lasted longer in the upper part for the rain. You pretty much have to stand there and continually poor water in it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest to put together.
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love this so 5 stars from the kids. I however was less than impressed while putting it together. There are no predrilled holes at all and you more or less have to guess where they go. It also takes two people to put this thing together which is fine if you have someone at home to help you (my hubs farms never home when I need him). I had to have my 6 year old help so the parts are wiggly. After completing the put together it's great but this was very difficult for a 9 month pregnant mom to do.
customer_reviews.author: TDR

customer_reviews.title: This is a great and very entertaining water table with multiple places to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and very entertaining water table with multiple places to play. For those wondering about height, your child needs to be able to reach 34" to pour water in the top. My daughter is 5yrs and 46" tall for reference and she loves this table! Even if your kid isn't tall enough for the upper deck, there is lots of room to play below. 3-4 kids could easily play simultaneously at this water table. Go to the Dollar Store and buy measuring cups, funnels, and scoopers to use for extra fun!
customer_reviews.author: mnback

customer_reviews.title: AFTER THE RESEARCH - THIS IS THE ONE WE BOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome outdoor toy. Very ez to put together. Very sturdy, so much so that my 2 yr old granddaughter climbed in and was playing with it like a mini pool. The sturdy legs did not collapse or fold. She was cramped but safe. The toys are a little more toddlerish, which is what we wanted. Not just a baby toy. We want her to enjoy it for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Tj S.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy as much as my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: This water table has the most activities and parts of ALL the water tables we looked at. It does "rain" from the top, pours down into spouts and moving parts, includes a toy frog flipper, a water wheel, cups and buckets for pouring... I don't think there is a table my child would enjoy more. I even enjoy playing with the chain reaction and flinging the included toys. I definitely recommend this for any child who enjoys pouring and splashing and water in general - lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Miller Family

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old son loves it. So do my 8 and 10 year olds (for getting into water fights)..
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 3Dragons

customer_reviews.title: You need a drill to make your own holes and it takes long time to put it together. Very fustrating.
customer_reviews.text: That is absolutely ridiculous. 😡 I order that with the good intention to make my toddler happy. 5 days later it’s half way build and we can’t use it bc by some reason you are supposed to drill holes in the plastic which is hard by yourself. Seriously...? I have no man help so how am I suposues to that??????
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: love the design and how big it is
customer_reviews.text: love the design and how big it is. My almost 2 year old loves it so much I have to tear her away from it in tears. What I DID NOT like was that I have to screw the legs, towers and the water trough into the plastic. It wouldn't be that big a deal except NOW water gets into the empty space in between and there is no good way to get the water out unless I want to drill another hole on the bottom to drain it.
customer_reviews.author: Slick25

customer_reviews.title: So much work and Time to put together!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! If I knew what a pain in the butt this would be to put together, I never would have bought it. No holes in the product, so you have to use your strength to push holes with screwdriver into the plastic. Ridiculous. They couldn’t take the time to make some holes?
customer_reviews.author: Rashda

customer_reviews.title: HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two months ago and finally got around to putting it together for my sons birthday. This was supposed to be his big present. Unfortunately, he will not have his present from mom and dad because this came with many missing parts, as well as damaged parts. I’m extremely disappointed. It’s one thing to have your things messed up, it’s a totally different thing to disappoint your child on their birthday. If you do buy this product I suggest putting it together quickly to make sure you have all parts. Supposedly step 2 has a decent warranty that includes missing/damaged parts so I guess my next step is contacting them tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love this water table! Some of the things like the lily pad tend to fall off fairly easily but not a huge deal. They like the feature of being able to pour the water in the top and have it rain down. It is large enough that 4 kids can play around it at once.
customer_reviews.author: K. Motes

customer_reviews.title: Summertime Necessity
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for almost 2 years now and it’s filled up every day in the summertime. The water table is super sturdy when filled with water (enough so that our 1 year old can try to climb it without it budging) yet easy for an adult to move. It’s also tall enough that a small child would find it very difficult to get their face in or near the water unassisted. This is a good alternative for a kiddie pool and allows the kids to play and cool off. Easy to assemble; takes about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost my kid absolutely love this thing. He played with it for nearly 5 hours straight when we first got it. As for its job of being a toy, it is 5 stars. The bad: the box it came in was nearly destroyed and covered in tape from top to bottom. One of the legs was clearly bent and may post as a structural issue in the future. Also, there are no instructions included and I ended up with 6 extra screws. Assembly was not hard, but there seems to be a leak in the structure as the core of it is now full of water.
customer_reviews.author: Agwagger

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design EDIT: Stronger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: 4 metal screws holding each cheap plastic leg to a cheap plastic table cannot last. I have purchased other Step2 products, including a different water table, and was pleased. I don't understand why all the connections, including the 2 pieces on top, are secured by metal screws instead of snapping or pressing together like some of their other products. I would have purchased something else had I known. EDIT: It seems I was mistaken. This table is still in pretty good shape after sitting outside for a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: deacon green

customer_reviews.title: Screw holes make leaks
customer_reviews.text: First off, I love this water table. It is a good size for multiple kids to play with at the same time. The rain fall feature is for sure a favorite. But I had a few issues with this water table. The plastic table does not come with pre-drilled holes for assembly. This meant an extra step in setting up the table. I had even bigger issues with the second level. Because it gets screwed into the bottom of the table and through the legs for the second level, water ended up getting in the whole base and leaking out the bottom. Poor design. Even with the screws, the top level had some wobble to it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michels

customer_reviews.title: Appealing for many ages, doesn’t tip over!
customer_reviews.text: My son as a baby and now 14 month, continues to love this water table! It is sturdy, maneuvers well, doesn’t leak, and he can hold on to the side and it doesn’t tip over. It holds a lot of water and has a deep and shallow section for play and comes with toys like buckets, straining cups, and floating animals. It is kind of difficult to drain- I have to rock it back and forth to get the water to drain out of the hole and then end up soaking up the remaining water with a towel. It’s colorful, fun, and appealing for many ages. Overall, it’s awesome and I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SAHM Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I had higher hopes for this. It's fairly easy to put together with the instructions and looks nice once compete. My two big complaints are the plug and the STEM feature on the side. The plug is useless, it drips or leaks no matter what you do. As for the STEM feature, the purple gears never spin no matter what position you put them in with the other pieces. It will serve it's purpose but I expected better for the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki B

customer_reviews.title: Fun water structure for kiddos
customer_reviews.text: It was somewhat hard to assemble due to no specific holes in plastic. There were so markings where the holes are supposed to be, but this would have been very difficult to put together with only a screwdriver. I used a power tool and it was fine and fast to put together. I initially thought they did not send all the parts, however a couple of the parts were already assembled together which made the product seem like it was missing parts. About 17.5 inches tall so for shorter kiddos they might not be able to see the inside of the pool part, but it is a fun water structure. Loved by all.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Loved by a one year old
customer_reviews.text: We got this last summer for my sons first birthday. He absolutely loved it. It is a bit of a pain to put together. Holes are pre drilled and you're just screwing plastic. Ultimately I at least got it to stay together. I got this one specifically because my son enjoys sticking his hands under running water, so the water fall effect I thought would be a big hit. It definitely it. To help the water last longer you can put tape over some of the holes so it empties slower. We are still using it this summer. When summer is over and it gets cooler I plan to put something like rice or beans for sensory play.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water table! Our 2 year old loves it so much she won’t go inside. It’s relatively easy to assemble, took me about 30-40 minutes. It’s super stable and as far as I can tell there’s no leaking anywhere. The top shelf is a little too high for her to reach but she is quite small so she’ll grow into it. We put it on our apartment porch for some outdoor entertainment when I’m busy around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Racedo

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I researched different water tables and chose this one based on the reviews here, but was so disappointed! It's been extremely difficult to put together - I had to get my husband and brother in law to help and we gave up after an hour because the screws just weren't going into the plastic without pre-drilled holes. You need a power drill to put this thing together, which we don't have. Also, I received a bag of duplicate parts and a bunch of the accessories were missing. So we have a half-assembled table that doesn't even have all the accessories. Extremely disappointing, would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great table
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 1 year old and he is going to love it. I will say there were some issues putting it together. I would recommend having an electric drill for this because there are no holes for the screws and you have to go completely through plastic. Also, when I received this and put it together I thought I was missing both the "M" pieces and looked everywhere for them but they were already connected to the piece they needed to be connected to and they are the same color so it looked like it was 1 piece. Other than those two things, very easy to follow instructions and I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa K.

customer_reviews.title: NO HOLES FOR SCREW TOGETHER ASSEMBLY
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters ages 17 months and 2 1/2 years are really enjoying this water table very much ... now. UNFORTUNATELY, Not only was the assembly difficult, there were NO HOLES for the screw assembly and my poor daughter had to DRILL them herself!!!! So I Would caution anyone looking for a water table to look at all of the other options and read the reviews on assembly before buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES his new water table! And we love the hours of joy it brings him! It’s perfect on a nice summer day when you don’t have time to fill a kiddie pool, but you want to keep your little cool! For weekends we fill a kiddie pool and the water table, but he usually spends his time playing at the table. A friend told me to bring the water table inside during the winter and add a few buckets of snow, just put towels or blankets under the table! My only complaint - Step2 if all of your toys require people to screw through plastic, could you please drill the holes in advance!
customer_reviews.author: lindsey

customer_reviews.title: No predrilled holes and no directions
customer_reviews.text: For a toddlers toy. This requires drilling some holes for the bottom 3 leg support and the upper sections / 2 sides. A little disappointing as I have a toddler and it’s hard to put things together much less having to quarantine the kiddo while you drill and assemble. Also came with no assembly directions. I’m sure kiddo will love it as soon as water gets put in.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Assembly But Still Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 1-year-old’s birthday. She absolutely loves it, and the older kids did not scoff at it either. Assembly took about 30 minutes by myself. There are no predrilled holes in the plastic, which was incredibly frustrating to find out when I opened it. There were dimples to show where the screws go. The instructions say you only need a manual screwdriver to create holes with the screws. That was definitely not the case. I needed to use the electric drill. It went quickly once I got the hang of it though. Overall I am very pleased with the purchase and can see my kids playing with this for a long time without getting tired of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get screws in
customer_reviews.text: Super cute table and love the top that makes it rain. Wish it had a pump to keep the water running to the top. We bought one to install, but haven't done it yet. Have to get a huge extension cord. My only real issue is that it's difficult to put together. I had to have another adult's help so it still isn't totally together and I'm afraid I lost one of the screws. One suggestion for improvement is to make little circles where the screws go so the plastic is thinner there and you can get the screws through easier.
customer_reviews.author: Neptune5

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice water table. I like the size, though much more than two or three children playing would be a little crowded. It has nice features and the extra toys it comes with are really all you need. I'm hoping in the winter to drain/dry and convert to a sand table. It really wont be that great as a sand table, but it will work to keep a toddler occupied. It is easy to clean even during pollen season, just hose off. The basin could be angled a little more downward to help all the water drain out, you do have to tip it over to get all the water out.
customer_reviews.author: Abailey

customer_reviews.title: Great water table for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves this. It comes with lots of accessories, most of which he could care less about and to me don’t add much excitement (concept cooler than reality). However it is a tub of water with buckets to fill and pour. That part he loves and that makes this a great buy. It has a plug on the bottom to drain, but I just tip it over. I keep the toys on the top “rack” to ensure they dry out between uses. I imagine this will last well past the point where my son is interested.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: overall kids loves it.
customer_reviews.text: at first, I did not like how its assemble..I saw some review that its impossible to screw together.. yes. it is because there's NO SCREW HOLES. I just pushed with screw that came with and I was able to put them together but it does damages the product and I'm not sure if you can return damaged product. but that's only way to put this water table together.. but my kids loves it and no hassle to clean after water play. I wish that they improve with assembling the table..accessories that came with this product can entertains 1~7yrs old kids.
customer_reviews.author: minji uyeshiro

customer_reviews.title: Not as hard to install as everyone makes it out to be.......
customer_reviews.text: This water playset is awesome our daughter loves it! EASY to put together...if your able to comprehend basic installation instructions, has pictures and diagrams depicting the exact size screw and where it should be screwed into. Well balanced and sits well. Here's to many fun afternoons with the kids playing!
customer_reviews.author: DEWY

customer_reviews.title: Comes with all the toys in the photos
customer_reviews.text: This water table is sturdy, durable and fun! Pros: -Heavy enough that it’s doesn’t get locked up the the wind - Come with all the toys shown in the pictures (buckets, rubber duck, frog, spoon, water wheel etc) - has stopper in the bottom that can be used to drain - kids lover pouring water in the top tray and seeing it fall down Cons: - the water does not quite full drain out so you need to wipe away the last drops of water if you want it to be completely dry - No cover. We bought a mini grill cover to cover this up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Tori P. :star:

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: 1 yr old LOVES it and her 3 and 6 year old brothers love playing with her in it too. Enough stimulation to keep them all happy and cool. GO FOR IT.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Instant Mom of the Year Award for this purchase
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband and me 15 minutes to put together but I cheated and used a drill. No way I’m hand screwing those screws into plastic. Regardless, once it was put together this was a big hit at our house. The kids love it and it’s an EXTREMELY sturdy water table. I’m so impressed with Step 2’s products, nothing is ever flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: The overall function of the water table is great. It has plenty of things for my son to do and interact with and in general is quite solid. However, one of the holes to place accessories (such as the "frog flipper") is to small to accommodate anything. Additionally, when assembled, the two towers that support the second level of the water table are not particularly solid, even though there are supposed to be two screws holding it in place. Otherwise, it certainly works and is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son's birthday. He loves it. It was a little daunting to put together since you had to drill into plastic to attach the parts. Measure twice, drill once. It comes with a great selection of toys and water carriers. My son's favorite is the launcher attachment, which allows small toys and water to be launched in the air with a flick. Should last through the next kids at least. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: n8sb

customer_reviews.title: Love our water table!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 17 month's old an we've had the table since the beginning of summer an she LOVES this water table so much! Her favorite part is the rain fall! An we love how many toys it came with. 13 of them that's awesome! It has very sturdy legs an has plenty of room for multiple kids to stand around an all play at once!! An also a spot to have a umbrella if you want!! Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It's year two with this product and my daughter loves this. I bring out the water toys and fill it up and she is distracted for hours while I get to relax in the sun. Definitely worth the purchase. Also, we stored this outside for the entire 2 years in hot AZ weather and it's held up really well!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Downing

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces in package
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 2 weeks ago and we just assembled it tonight. After putting it together we realized we have two pieces that did not come with the package. Besides calling the customer service that's only available till 5pm, I dont know how else to get information on how to get those items now.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy & Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for summer play
customer_reviews.text: My now 4 year old and 7 year old grandchildren loved this all last year and are still excited about it this year. The 4 year old stays interested longer but the 7 year old still likes it. It’s a nice size, not too big for my deck but big enough so they can both play. Seems sturdy and well put together. It was a little bit of a pain to put together but I’m not very handy and I managed with a little help from my sister.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old and corgi love this! She loves pouring the water on the ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old and corgi love this! She loves pouring the water on the top area to make the rain shower.
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.text: Love this water toy for my 14 month he absolutely loves it. Only thing is its missing one slid piece the like red slide. so when you pour the water on top it goes down to the yellow bucket like toy then the two red slid then last the purple trun toys
customer_reviews.author: Janice Dement

customer_reviews.title: Hours of summer time fun!
customer_reviews.text: Hours of fun! Our two year old loves this. He asks for it every day and plays for a long time with it on our back patio. He loves the waterfall, especially when we sing, “rain, rain, go away!” We’ve also added the Munchkin bath animal toys and he loves adding bubbles to the water table. This is very sturdy. I can tell it will last for many years. It’s also great that it has a drain. Definitely worth the $70.
customer_reviews.author: Amy-n-Dave

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: This water table is the best thing ever! We've seen other brands/styles, we did our research, but this one turned out to be the best & I'm so glad we spent the money on it. Setup was super easy except there were no pre-drilled holes so make sure you have a drill handy! Other than that, my boys absolutely love it! I have a 9 month old & 4 1/2 year old & they're both obsessed with it with plenty room to grow! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BoyMama

customer_reviews.title: An instant hit! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter for some summer fun at home. She LOVES it! I’m glad I chose the one with the rain feature because it adds a special element than your basic water table. It’s lightweight when empty so easy to move and to store. Assembly: definitely use a power drill. The instructions say to use a hand screwdriver but that’s not gonna cut it. There are hardly any words to accompany the directions but it’s pretty straight forward and easy to assemble. Took about 10-15 minutes. I love that this water table comes with plenty of accessories too. Perfect for sharing.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: great summer outdoor toy
customer_reviews.text: We bought it as a birthday gift for our 2 year old niece and she loved it. However, we found it a bit difficult to put together by one person and there wasn't any pre-drilled holes, so it took two adults to put together in the end. The material seems to be safe for kids as there wasn't any funny smell and should easily fit 2-3 little kids to play together. It is a great toy for the hot summer days ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Trani

customer_reviews.title: Awesome way to pass the time and get outside
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my two young boys to help deal with quarantine boredness. They loved everything all the way down to the box itself. They play wet or dry in it. Haven't used sand because one of my guys likes to throw it. But the water is so much fun for them. They like how the water rains down from the top level and love to launch the toys off the side launcher. Keeps them busy for a solid hour. Great peace and quiet time!
customer_reviews.author: Karli C.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a range of ages— my 0 and 3 year old both love it!
customer_reviews.text: Something my almost 4 year old and almost 1 year old can do together! They have so much fun splashing together. She can reach the top, so she makes him laugh by putting things up there or pouring water dow. The spouts. He can’t reach that high yet, but he splashed and plays with the toys in the bottom. It’s sturdy enough for him to be able to hold on and not knock it over. It’s perfect. I thought my daughter would be too old for a water table, so that’s why I paid a little more for tris one— it looked like it would keep her interest, and it does.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating assembly
customer_reviews.text: I’m pausing after roughly an hour of assembly (with breaks) to write about my frustration. I’m trying to put this together by myself and it seems to be a 2 person job. There are no pre-drilled screw holes, so you have to apply a lot of pressure to get the screws through the plastic with a screwdriver. It’s pretty hard. If I ever finish, I’ll update this review for the actual user experience and fun my kids hopefully have with it. UPDATE: We tried it out for this first time and the kids loved it, so the frustration of putting it together was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Ginsburg

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my grandson who was turning 2. He loves playing in water and this has become his favorite toy. It has so many different ways to make the water flow and he has created a few of his own. My daughter put it on their back porch and he can splash to his hearts content. It seems to be of high quality sturdy material and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ERBS

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter, LOVED it!
customer_reviews.text: The Water Table was delivered today ahead of schedule. Took it to my son's house so he could put it together. My soon to be 6 yr old was anxious to put it together and told his dad where to put the screws. My 4 yr old granddaughter loved her late birthday present. (We had to cancel one order and order again). Many hours of fun are in the future after spending 2 solid hours playing today.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun in the sun (with SPF 50)!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 month old and she enjoys it! She’s able to splash around and cool down during the hot summer days! She’s able to stand and pull up by herself and this table is a good height and sturdy enough for that use. I think as she gets a little older this table will be even more fun for her to use! Love the bright colors and made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Kris13

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my son’s first birthday. It arrived today and took maybe 45 minutes to assemble and set up. I advise using a power drill as that made the project super easy! I had no problem creating the holes and found the instructions easy to follow. The table feels sturdy and there are lots of little activities. The best part is I could hardly tear my son away from it tonight to eat dinner! I completely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: OUKristy

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water table when I finally found it at its retail price of $70. Very hard to find because its sold out everywhere and people are reselling them for OVER $100 which is ridiculous. This table was an instant hit for the kids. They loved splashing everywhere. Very easy to assemble with a power drill. I had it up in about 10 minutes. So happy I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE ASSEMBLY.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to assemble. Apparently there are screws they expect you to drill into the plastic with because there were no holes and no directions on where to drill these screws through. the screws either: are not long enough or they don’t screw all the way through the plastic leaving some screw pieces exposed. NOT A FAN of the assembly but my son seems to enjoy the table and it is cute.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Water collects inside
customer_reviews.text: This was just the thing I was looking for to keep my toddler active during hot days. However the major flaw of the product is that water collect inside the plastic that cannot be drained. I’ve found that every time we move the water table you can hear water swishing inside. I’m afraid it will become moldy because of this issue. I’m also disappointed that the waterfall doesn’t last long. Other than those two issues, it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya S

customer_reviews.title: Too much fun
customer_reviews.text: My 1&1/2 toddler loved splashing with all of the toys in this water table. She was occupied for a good 30 mins until I brought her in to dry off and have dinner. She had so much fun that I literally had to peel her away kicking and screaming. She had now 2 tantrums, once with me and once now with hubby. So buyer beware, your toddler might have too much fun and not want the fun to end. We definitely recommend this water table!! It's a no brainer, so worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn's mommy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for toddlers, easy to clean, good investment overall
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son on his first birthday months ago and he loves it. It came with a nice assortment of accessories and provides great entertainment. I do wish the items you can attach fit a little tighter as my son likes to tear them all off, but I'm sure it won't he an issue as he gets older. I have noticed some leaking underneath (not from the plug, so I have no idea what's causing it), but it isn't consistent or bad enough to cause the water to drop quickly. Easy enough to empty and clean when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Happy 2 Year Old
customer_reviews.text: I loved how this looked and wanted to give it to my daughter for her 2nd birthday. There were lots of negative reviews of ordering problems so I hesitated. Then a couple of days later, this seller appeared with good reviews. I decided to order it and I’m SO happy I did! My daughter absolutely loves it!! It arrived in 6 days and wasn’t too difficult to put together. If you’re thinking of getting a water table for your child, get this one. It’s fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Great table.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy for kids. Used with water, sand, and ordbeez? Small enough to fit in a room, and durability is not an issue for outside use. Only concern was the long metal screws provided to assemble the parts. They take some force. Wear gloves for protection, possibly pre-drill the holes? Otherwise no issues, just did not expect to have to attach 3 inch screws into hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Cstmr

customer_reviews.title: kids love this
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took 2 people and a drill to get the screws in the harder angles going. A bit awkward but not bad. The two kids, 3 and 5, loved it and spent a long time making up stories with it. I have a flexible hose that could be positioned in the top section to allow a continuous rain when they wanted it. The 5 year old spent some quiet time figuring out water properties, such as flow and direction, using a leaf as a prop. The plug did not leak. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Milana

customer_reviews.title: kids love
customer_reviews.text: This one is sturdy, not just one layer of plastic. Everything has screws, so it isn't coming apart, nothing is coming loose. I used a drill and it only took me about 20 minutes to assemble, even with the preschoolers "helping" me. This thing is also big. It's definitely big enough for 4 kids to play around and not bump into each other too much.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight but very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: There were no predrilled holes for the screws, just indentations where they should be placed. Otherwise, super easy assembly. It is big enough that my two year old can climb into the tub. We put bubbles in the water and the kids loved it! We have also used it for a rice station. It is very light so is easy to clean. Drains well. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mylinda Fancher

customer_reviews.title: Missing the assembly parts, useless water table.
customer_reviews.text: This awesome water table was delivered a day early, which is great! Except it didn’t come with any screws to assemble it soo the hype was short lived once we realized we couldn’t put it together. The screws and the water plug must come in the same bag with the duck and frog, because we don’t have that bag at all. I contacted amazon and the only thing they could do was send us a new one, take out what we needed, and return the rest. Except it would take over a week to get it! They offered 20% off, so now I’m left with a water table I can’t use. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good water table for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This has been a pretty good water table, which we bought when my son was two. He has just turned 4 and is tall for his age (over 42 inches). He's had to hunch over for the lower/main water area for a year already. I think he'll only get another summer's use out of this water table! Great for younger toddlers and maybe up to 5 or 6 years old max.
customer_reviews.author: KTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. My boys love playing with water and I finally caved and started doing some research. Thought this was one was the best based on reviews. It was fairly easy to put together, I was able to do it by myself. My boys love their tablets but ever since we got this, they did not touch it
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mauk

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids of different ages
customer_reviews.text: One of the best water tables, especially for the price. It has a bunch of features, kept my son entertained since he was 1( it did not feel too big); at the age of 3,5 he is still playing with it every day when it is hot outside. He is 40 inches tall and it does not feel small at all. In times of quarantine it is definitely a must have if you have a yard.
customer_reviews.author: Julia K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tots!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son absolutely loves this water table. He is constantly “making it rain” or squirting me and other family with the toy fish and frog that come with it. He’s a water bug and I’m glad we bought it. It’s well crafted and very sturdy. I like that you can drain it from the plug in the middle of the table. If you’ve got small kiddos that like to play outside I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Garroch

customer_reviews.title: Should have been sold as opened box item
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water table for the kids. When we opened the box everything was in the box but definitely had been opened and used before we received the table. The bottom of the table had sand on it and the bag of toys had been opened. We love the table, just feel we should have received it as a opened box item, maybe discount because it had been opened and used before us.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Set Up - Frustrating, Time Consuming, Wiggly
customer_reviews.text: Really, Step 2? There are 20 screws (some of them more than 6cm long) and you need to forcefully screw through multiple pieces of wiggly, not pre-drilled plastic!!! Can't Step2 get some engineers to work to figure out a more user-friendly set up? Each screw took us several minutes... and my poor 1.5yr old needed to wait almost 1.5h until that toy was set up. I've put together DOZENS of TOYS and (some complex) IKEA FURNITURE and never complained, but the SET UP of THIS STEP2 TOY is a) unexpected (given the simplicity of the toy itself), b) takes away all the toddler fun due to the time it takes until the toy can be used after unboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Heinrichs

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a taped up previously opened package. All hardware missing and someone left a screwdriver in there. I am pretty disgusted since this was a move in gift for my grandson who just arrived at his house in a new state. Sure didn’t bring any joy. If I was buying USED I should have been told up front and definitely should have been at a reduced price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rain showers splash pond water pond.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter. It had so many parts to it to put it together. It was huge. It says for an 18 month old child. It was too big for her. When I tried to send it back they sent me a label but I would have to pay the shipping back to them.
customer_reviews.author: sweete

customer_reviews.title: Fun but a pain to put together
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this table. My only issue is that everything gets screwed together. I assumed the plastic pieces would just snap in place making it easy to take apart. There aren't holes, so you have to do that yourself also. The instructions say a screwdriver would work, but I used a cordless drill. For a lightweight child's toy, I don't think screws are necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fills with water and leaks: missing toys
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water table for my son’s birthday party. I purchased it as an “open box” and it was dirty, used, and missing several toys. Also, this table is poorly designed. For some reason water gets trapped inside the big base piece and leaks everywhere continuously. I haven’t figured out how to get the trapped water to completely empty. Disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Check the parts!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not checking to see if everything was there before I started assembly. Got the legs screwed in and realized we were missing the whole top section.... Such a bummer especially since these things aren't cheap and will be a hassle to take a part and ship back. *Update* contacted Step2 about the missing part and they had a replacement in the mail after a 5 minute phone call. Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.author: colleen

customer_reviews.title: Most difficult to assemble kids toy I've ever experienced....
customer_reviews.text: The assembly for this product requires metal screws. Metal screws that will rust when exposed to water. That is if you can even get the screws into the product. It comes with no actual screw holes, just small indentions that you have to push screws through plastic to put the entire thing together. not pleased...
customer_reviews.author: nbert

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to put together
customer_reviews.text: I just put this together. It took me a few HOURS. I don’t know what’s wrong with written words, but the instructions were all in pictures and you had to guess what they were showing. There are no pre-drilled holes so screwing in the tough plastic took a lot of strength. It looks sturdy and I think my grandson will like it, but they really need to improve on the instruction booklet and pre-drill some holes for the screws!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Rice

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved playing with this water table. My 2 yr old especially loved it the most but my 11 and 13 yr old had a blast getting wet at the table with him. I've never seen them so engaged with play and my son was sad to put it up once it turned dark outside. Hubs put it together in less than 20 minutes but you will definitely need a drill because there are no premade holes in the table where the screws need to be screwed in. Other than that this thing gave hours of fun and I'm sure it will continue for years to come as I'm expecting another one due soon.
customer_reviews.author: Shante Dayz

customer_reviews.title: Good water table
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water table! But I wish the top part of it functioned differently so that the water continues to pour out from it. But drainage is simple which i like! It came with lots of toys and it’s a cute little table. The sturdiness of it may be questionable, I was trying to set it up and My son knocked it over onto himself but I’m sure with the water weighing it down it wouldn’t do that. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Michaelah

customer_reviews.title: Great for young toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month old loves this table. She asks to go outside and play with it every day when she comes back home from daycare and also on weekends. It is great to learn to hold a cup of water and not spill it, and practice transferring liquid from one cup to the other. She loves the frog, duck and fish that come with it but she still gravitates to the cups and bucket more. I wish I had gotten this table months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I got this for my 3 year old grandson. Put it together easily and filled it with warm water (it was a little cool outside still). He and his sister, who is 7, played with it for hours. He is a little on the short side so we used his little step stool so that he could use the upper feature easily to 'make it rain!' I thought it was a little pricey but loved seeing the enjoyment he got out of playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: rella88

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced
customer_reviews.text: This item was too expensive, given it's capacity for fun. There isn't really a rain shower. The children have to keep dipping the water from the lower tier and pouring it into the upper tier to maintain a "rain shower". It is a monotonous task and the water doesn't dribble down for long, before you need to pour more water into the upper tier. Unless you want to keep the water running from your hose indefinitely, which is a waste of water. I was very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer fun.
customer_reviews.text: My son recieved 2 of these for his birthday. Was a little time consuming for me to put together because it does not have screw holes. You have to apply pressure with screw to make a hole. Other than that instructions were easy to follow. Comes with buckets and water toys. My 3-year-old loves it. Keeps him busy for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought this water table for our 20 month old son and he loves it. The toys keep him busy for hours plus we have added more toys. He also thinks it’s fun to climb inside and it doesn’t tip over, very sturdy. It’s easy to drain after use and it is light weight to pick it up and move around, when it’s empty. The only con I have is with the setting up, it would be helpful to indicate markers where the screws go in.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan & Sandra

customer_reviews.title: A beast to assemble, but a hit with the kids
customer_reviews.text: This was a BEAST to assemble. It’s held together by screws, but there are NO GUIDE HOLES in the (rather hard) plastic, so I had to get out the electric drill. Once I got over my grumpiness about that (and my guilt over spending that much money on it), it’s turned out to be a huge hit with our boys age 3.5 and 1.5. All of which to say: be prepared to get your DIY on - and to have delighted children.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves this!
customer_reviews.text: For playing, this is a 5 star toy. My grandson loves and it it is sturdy enough that he climbs into it and sits (he is only 22 pounds, and this is NOT it's intended use). What I do not like is that you have to use screws to put it together meaning that you have to set it up and leave it that way. So when you want to store it for winter, it will be in the put-together size, and not able to take it apart and store it more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Magill

customer_reviews.title: use a power drill. it'll make the install super easy.
customer_reviews.text: instructions were easy to follow. like everyone else says you'll need a power drill. if you use a manual screw driver good luck. use a power drill, you'll be done in 15mins easy. product works exactly as designed. kids love playing with it. there's no leakage and we've had it for about 5 months now. everything is sturdy, doesn't tip over, easy to drain, and clean.
customer_reviews.author: AdamWorkingHard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water toy
customer_reviews.text: My 2YO loves this toy and prefers to splash the water out of it instead of playing with the toys. Other times he just likes flipping his toys across the yard. However, what we like most is that it’s not overly thematic so he can use his own imagination. I considered the other tables but I didn’t want him to be locked into a singular idea of how to play with the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, assembly kind of sucked compared to other ...
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, assembly kind of sucked compared to other similar products but only for the 4 long screws, other than that it was easy. Kids love it, 6 year old and 3 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Form over function.
customer_reviews.text: Cool pool that baby really likes, but probably wont last. Had to screw into plastic to assemble which will just create openings for water to get into and become trapped creating mold. Aside from this creating a pain to assemble, just seems like a really bad idea. Water in the basin doesnt fully drainn when plug is pulled.
customer_reviews.author: christine b.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The table is great! I was hesitant to pay the pricey cost but glad I did. It’s providing plenty of outdoor fun with other toys for the kids. I’ve read other reviews complaining about putting it together, but we had no issues. Yes, be forewarned, there are no predrilled holes so use a drill when putting together. Easy for one person to do. Overall I’m extremely happy I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: B.Shulthise

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, my kids LOVE this. The little included toys are great and it is very sturdy. Although the rainfall effect only works when you pour water in the top, it is a very cool feature. We sometimes place a hose up there to keep the waterfall flowing. Also, it was very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: SACPHX

customer_reviews.title: Large, and lots of entertainment.
customer_reviews.text: Like all of the Step 2 toys you have to actually put work into putting it together. Once past that though it's great. My 16 month old loves it. She takes all of the pieces off and throws them around so if that's something you would find annoying I wouldn't get this one but it's still very entertaining for her.
customer_reviews.author: Becca14

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!
customer_reviews.text: I searched water tables a million times and finally decided on this one. I'm glad I did because it is really sturdy, so I'm not concerned about it tipping over. My one year old absolutely loves it! My only gripe is that she isn't tall enough to pour the water in the top. But overall this was a great buy that I think will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Asbury

customer_reviews.title: Gross-was sent used and all dirty.
customer_reviews.text: Producted was sent as a used Item... what the heck? Grosses me out that it was used and sent all dirty with sand residue. Very unhappy. Will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great summer toy, build with a buddy
customer_reviews.text: This is a two person assembly. There are times when you have to awkwardly press and screw in the screw at the same time. And a second person to push from the other side (so it does not slide away) is great to have. The directions were pretty self-explanatory, and hard to mess up. A long handled screwdriver would be great to have, or a power screwdriver would be even better. But it’s a great, fun toy. The two year old and five year old love it. No problems with the drain. Seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K.

customer_reviews.title: Much fun and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It is a hit! My 2y old loves it. It is sturdy, light weight and easy to move around. Although the holes are not premade it is easy to assemble with the screwdriver. Not a problem at all. My sister did it by herself while I was at work. She said it was easy. It has a little trampoline for the frog that my daughter really enjoys and it's so funny to look at. I highly recommend it for a summer day full of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Dra.MHC

customer_reviews.title: Fun table for many ages
customer_reviews.text: We love this water table - my 8 year old, 5 year old, and 3 year old can all play together with plenty of room around the table. I wish that the waterfall part would drain for a little longer, water runs through immediately and needs to be refilled. Kids didn’t complain but I was slightly disappointed. I almost didn’t buy this table when I heard the holes weren’t predrilled, but glad I took a chance. I got my drill out and was easily able to drill the screws in, total assembly was approx a half hour, not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen S

customer_reviews.title: 18 Month Old LOVES IT
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old son likes to play with this a lot. I ended up not using it as a water table and more for just a toy table for him to play on. He thoroughly enjoys running his cars along it. I also use it outside and fill it with water like youre supposed to and it is equally as fun! Not super easy to assemble, but I did it in 30 minutes while 9 months pregnant. So it's definitely foolproof if I can do it haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy.. Extremely difficult to assemble 🙁
customer_reviews.text: I am having to wait for my husband to get home tonight to assemble this. I was able to get the legs done but my thumb is red and sore from it.. That alone took over 30 mins.. Probably longer. The green plastic is much. I cant even get the drill to pierce it. Maybe I will write a review to corporate on not having holes already done. There are complaints on here from years ago but the issue hasn't been addressed. Such a fun toy but a royal pain to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Hall

product_meta.title: Step2 Rain Showers Splash Pond Water Table | Kids Water Play Table with 13-Pc Accessory Set
product_meta.description: Style:Without Umbrella| Design:PlaySetCreate a mini water park right in your back yard with the Rain Showers Splash Pond Water Table by Step2. The two-tier design creates a showering splash below! Just scoop up water from the pond and pour into the top tray to make it rain. Watch as the rainfall activates the maze-like spinners and ramps, a great way to show a cause and effect relationship. From the side flipper to the put-and-place maze pieces, kids will have lots of splish-splash fun with the included water table accessories! Basin holds up to 5 gal. of water.
feature_bullets: This kids’ water table will create a mini water park right in your backyard! Use the large bucket to scoop up water from the pond and pour into the top waterfall tray. Watch as the rainfall effect is activated as the water splashes into the pond!

As the waterfall drains back into the water table pond, maze-like spinners, ramps and buckets are activated! Rearrange the put-and-place maze pieces to create new waterfalls for fun cause and effect STEM play
Kids can make a spinning splash in the “rain” with the hand-held spinning wheel and use the side flipper to flip figures back into the pond!
In the box: Water table, 13-piece accessory kit including a large bucket, 2 cups, rubber duck, 1 frog water squirter, 1 fish water squirter, a strainer, flipper, 2 spinning pieces and 3 maze pieces.
Note from Step2: All Step2 water tables come with pictured accessories for no added charge

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,373 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
